item.title: 保时捷正在接受 7.5 亿欧元舒尔信债务出售竞标
item.description: 保时捷汽车控股公司（Porsche Automobil Holding SE）已开始出售一笔至少 7.5 亿欧元的舒尔茨证券（Schuldschein）交易，这是该德国利基债务市场有史以来最大的一笔交易。【原文：Porsche Automobil Holding SE has begun the sale of a Schuldschein transaction of at least €750 million, the largest-ever marketed deal in this niche German debt market.】

item.title: 谷歌因人工智能聊天机器人交易面临反垄断调查
item.description: 据知情人士透露，美国司法部正在调查 Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司是否违反了反垄断法，因为该公司同意使用一家流行聊天机器人制造商的人工智能技术。【原文：The Justice Department is probing whether Alphabet Inc.’s Google violated antitrust law with an agreement to use the artificial intelligence technology of a popular chatbot maker, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 加拿大预算压力增大，卡尼指望人工智能节省开支
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，加拿大将开始 "大规模 "使用人工智能，以提高政府的工作效率。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada will begin to use artificial intelligence “at scale” to make the government more productive, as his administration looks for ways to squeeze out cost savings in a time of economic pressure.】

item.title: 埃及在夏季改革前连续第二次降息
item.description: 埃及在数月内第二次降息，力图在今年夏天可能进行的新一轮财政改革再次引发谨慎之前促进经济增长。【原文：Egypt cut interest rates for the second time in as many months, seeking to boost economic growth before a likely fresh round of fiscal reforms this summer spurs renewed caution.】

item.title: 参议院投票决定终止加州汽油车禁令，并将法案提交给特朗普
item.description: 美国参议院投票否决了加利福尼亚州到 2035 年禁止使用汽油动力汽车和其他车辆的计划，并将该措施提交给唐纳德-特朗普总统签署。【原文：The US Senate voted to block a California program banning gasoline-powered cars and other vehicles by 2035, sending the measure to President Donald Trump’s desk for his signature.】

item.title: 牛津地产考虑出售 7 亿加元卢尼债券
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，牛津地产集团正在准备出售一笔 7 亿加元的债券，期限为 4 至 7 年。【原文：Oxford Properties Group is readying a C$700 million bond sale maturing between four and seven years, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国每年向毛里求斯支付 1.01 亿英镑以使用印度洋基地
item.description: 英国和毛里求斯就印度洋群岛的主权问题达成了协议，其中包括对该地区一个重要战略军事基地的控制权，从而结束了长期以来令英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）备受争议的谈判。【原文：The UK and Mauritius agreed to a deal regarding the sovereignty of an Indian Ocean archipelago, including control over a key strategic military base in the region, ending a long-running negotiation that had become a point of controversy for British premier Keir Starmer.】

item.title: 初创公司 Builder.ai 向主要债权人高估了 300% 的销售额
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，Builder.ai 去年寻求紧急贷款时，这家初创公司给贷款人的收入预测是实际销售额的四倍。【原文：When Builder.ai was seeking an emergency loan last year, the startup gave lenders a revenue forecast that proved to be four times its actual sales, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 纳格尔称，尽管通胀率接近 2%，欧洲央行仍须保持谨慎
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，尽管通胀率几乎已恢复到 2%，但欧洲中央银行必须保持警惕。【原文：The European Central Bank must remain vigilant, despite almost having returned inflation to 2%, Governing Council member Joachim Nagel said.】

item.title: 英国央行皮尔质疑冲击时代预测的重要性
item.description: 英国央行首席经济学家休-皮尔（Huw Pill）表示，日益频繁的经济冲击和不可靠的数据相结合，使得英国央行的预测变得不那么有用，英国央行行长的工作目前尤其 "具有挑战性"。【原文：A combination of increasingly frequent economic shocks and unreliable data has made Bank of England forecasts less useful and the job of UK central bankers particularly “challenging” at the moment, Bank of England Chief Economist Huw Pill said.】

item.title: 阿根廷电信公司在西班牙电信收购审查中出售债务
item.description: 阿根廷电信公司（Telecom Argentina SA）在收购西班牙电信公司（Telefonica SA）的本地部门后，正在利用国际债务市场进行融资，这项交易激起了哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）总统政府的强烈反对。【原文：Telecom Argentina SA is tapping international debt markets following its acquisition of Telefonica SA’s local unit, a transaction that has stoked fierce opposition from President Javier Milei’s government.】

item.title: 收购公司 GTCR 疯狂销售后创下 50 亿美元回报纪录
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，GTCR 已有望在一个日历年度内向投资者返还创纪录的 50 多亿美元，而此时同行正面临着客户要求返还资金的压力。【原文：GTCR is already on track to return a record $5 billion-plus to investors for a calendar year, people familiar with the matter said, at a time when peers are under pressure from clients who want their money back.】

item.title: 美国现房销售下降，创 2009 年以来最差四月记录
item.description: 美国 4 月份旧房销售量意外下滑，创下 7 个月来最慢增速，受制于持续的经济承受能力限制，凸显出春季销售旺季开局乏力。【原文：US sales of previously owned homes unexpectedly dropped in April to the slowest pace in seven months, restrained by ongoing affordability constraints and highlighting a lackluster start to the key spring selling season.】

item.title: OpenAI 宣布扩建阿布扎比星际之门数据中心
item.description: OpenAI 表示，它正在帮助阿联酋开发一个大型数据中心，这是其 "星际之门"（Stargate）努力建设人工智能基础设施的一次大规模海外扩张。【原文：OpenAI said it’s helping to develop a major data center in the United Arab Emirates, a big overseas expansion of its Stargate effort to build out AI infrastructure.】

item.title: 关税忧虑缓解，美国商业活动和情绪改善
item.description: 本月美国商业活动和产出预期有所改善，因为即使关税导致价格压力持续上升，与贸易有关的焦虑情绪也有所缓解。【原文：US business activity and output expectations improved this month as trade-related anxiety eased even as price pressures continued to mount due to tariffs.】

item.title: 特朗普税收法案在众议院以微弱优势获得通过，S&P 500 指数下跌
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的标志性税收法案以微弱优势获得众议院通过，美国 500 指数（S&P 500）周四走低。【原文：The S&P 500 inched lower on Thursday as President Donald Trump’s signature tax bill narrowly passed the House.】

item.title: 路威酩轩集团蝉联欧洲五大股票之首
item.description: 奢侈品制造商路威酩轩集团（LVMH）在欧洲五大上市公司中失去了一席之地，遭遇了自2008年金融危机以来最严重的年度下滑。【原文：LVMH lost its place among Europe’s top five listed companies as the luxury-goods maker endures its worst year-to-date slide since the 2008 financial crisis.】

item.title: 香奈儿斥资 1.18 亿欧元在巴黎旗舰店附近建造大楼
item.description: 香奈儿有限公司去年在其巴黎主要精品店附近斥巨资购置了一处房产，因为奢侈品牌都在努力争取其店铺的黄金地段。【原文：Chanel Ltd. splurged on a property near its main boutique in Paris last year as luxury brands seek to secure prime locations for their stores.】

item.title: 英国央行行长丁格拉称英国服务业受脱欧冲击严重
item.description: 英国央行利率制定者斯瓦蒂-丁格拉（Swati Dhingra）表示，有新的证据表明，英国脱欧对英国服务贸易造成的打击比之前意识到的要大。【原文：Bank of England rate-setter Swati Dhingra said there was new evidence that Brexit had dealt a bigger blow to Britain’s services trade than previously realized.】

item.title: 收购公司 EQT 接近达成收购水处理供应商 Seven Seas 的交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，EQT AB 正在就收购 Seven Seas Water Group 进行深入谈判，该公司是一家水处理解决方案供应商，业务遍及美国和拉丁美洲。【原文：EQT AB is in advanced talks to acquire Seven Seas Water Group, a water treatment solutions provider that operates throughout the US and Latin America, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 七国集团草案警告全球经济 "过度失衡
item.description: 七国集团的财政部长和央行行长们承诺解决全球经济 "过度失衡 "的问题，这一努力显然是针对中国的，尽管彭博新闻社看到的公报草案省略了中国的名字。【原文：Finance ministers and central bank governors from the Group of Seven nations pledged to address “excessive imbalances” in the global economy, an effort clearly aimed at China, though a draft communique seen by Bloomberg News omitted the name of the country.】

item.title: 纽约私立学校宣布破产后恳求捐助者继续办学
item.description: 在纽约一名破产法官拒绝了一所上西区私立学校的紧急贷款请求后，这所学校正在努力筹集足够的现金，以维持到学年结束。【原文：An Upper West Side private school is trying to raise enough cash to stay afloat until the end of the school year after a New York bankruptcy judge rejected its request for an emergency loan.】

item.title: 加密货币 DeFi 项目 Cetus 协议遭遇安全漏洞
item.description: 据区块链安全公司PeckShield Inc.称，Sui区块链上的去中心化加密货币交易所和主要流动性提供商Cetus Protocol周四因安全漏洞损失了2亿多美元。【原文：Cetus Protocol, a decentralized crypto exchange and key liquidity provider on the Sui blockchain, lost more than $200 million in a security breach on Thursday, according to blockchain security firm PeckShield Inc.】

item.title: 英国将考虑全面修改 CPI 数据，以更好地衡量通胀走向
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，英国正准备考虑全面修改每月的消费者物价指数数据，以平滑季节性波动，这一举措将有助于英国央行和投资者更好地判断通胀压力的变化。【原文：The UK is poised to consider overhauling its monthly consumer price index figures to smooth out seasonal swings, according to people familiar with the matter, a step that would help the Bank of England and investors better gauge the shifts in inflation pressures.】

item.title: 当波动性袭来时，ETF 交易实现了前所未有的自动化
item.description: 当市场出现混乱时，华尔街受困的交易员们历来都想依靠人情味来帮助自己渡过波动期。【原文：When markets go haywire, embattled traders on Wall Street have historically been tempted to rely on the human touch to help navigate through the volatility.】

item.title: 美国初请失业金人数降至四周来最低水平
item.description: 美国失业救济金申请降至四周低点，进一步证明在贸易政策带来的不确定性不断增加的情况下，就业市场依然健康。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits fell to a four-week low, adding to evidence that the job market remains healthy in the face of growing uncertainty tied to trade policy.】

item.title: 德意志银行削减面临关税风险客户的风险敞口
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）在进行了一系列内部压力测试后，减少了对美国新关税敏感的公司的风险敞口。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG has reduced its exposure to companies that are sensitive to the new US tariffs, after the German lender conducted a series of internal stress tests.】

item.title: 枪支制造商柯尔特 CZ 计划进行更多收购，到 2030 年将销售额翻一番
item.description: Colt CZ 集团 SE 宣布计划在未来五年内将销售额和营业利润翻一番，主要通过收购来实现，因为这家捷克枪支制造商将从公共安全支出的增加中获益。【原文：Colt CZ Group SE announced plans to double both its sales and operating profit over the next five years, mostly through acquisitions, as the Czech gunmaker benefits from increased public spending on security.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔提出下半年降息路线
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，如果特朗普政府对美国贸易伙伴征收的关税稳定在10%左右，那么央行可能会在2025年下半年降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said the central bank could cut interest rates in the second half of 2025 if the Trump administration’s tariffs on US trading partners settle around 10%.】

item.title: 墨西哥通胀加速超出预期，因为 Banxico 放宽了通胀限制
item.description: 墨西哥通胀率在 5 月的前两周加速超过预期，在经济出现停滞迹象的情况下，墨西哥央行积极降低利率。【原文：Mexico’s inflation accelerated more than expected in the first two weeks of May, with the central bank aggressively cutting interest rates amid signs the economy is stalling.】
